How can park spaces be made more welcoming for transgender visitors?

Focus on improving the experience of spaces that are often highly gendered â€“ e.g. bathrooms, pools, showers and locker rooms. These spaces are where transgender visitors are likely to feel the most uncomfortable. Prioritize privacy; ensure your bathrooms have stall doors, showers have curtains, etc.

there should be at least one stall with a door in each bathroom and curtains or other barriers in all showers.

What are ways Parks and Rec pros can promote inclusive park programming?

  • Develop a written policy of inclusion that allows participants to choose the program and the facilities that best meet their needs.
  • Offer co-ed and non-gendered sports like roller derby
  • Create transgender-specific programming to help these visitors learn athletic skills that were not a part of their birth-gender upbringing
  • Connect with your local transgender community to help ensure that they are providing equitable access that meets the needs of the community.

Where can I learn more?

Learn from your peers! Start or join the conversation about more inclusive parks at community.muniparks.com.

Recommended Reading:

  • JPRA “Dreaming About Access: The Experiences of Transgender Individuals in Public Recreation”
